robot

Class Scanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • robot.Scanner

  • public class Scanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Scanner class which implements logic for scanning lights and obstacles Adapted from ScanRecorder.java in the skeleton
    Author:
    Khoa Tran, Phuoc Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • scanLights

        public void scanLights(int startAngle,
              int endAngle)
        scan both ways for 2 sets of angle, in order to calculate the mean of it
        Parameters:
        startAngle - - where to begin scanning
        endAngle - - where to end scanning

      • getDistanceToWall

        public int getDistanceToWall(float angle)
        Returns the echo distance to the wall at a given angle
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle the head should rotate to
        Returns:
        the echo distance at that angle

      • rotateTo

        public void rotateTo(int angle,
            boolean instantReturn)
        Rotates the scanner head to the angle
        Parameters:
        angle - - how much to rotate to
        instantReturn - - if true, we don't wait until the whole rotate process completes

      • getHeadAngle

        public int getHeadAngle()
        Returns:
        the angle that the head is currently looking in.

      • getBearings

        public float[] getBearings()
        Returns:
        the relative bearings to the light beacons stored in scanner
